title: why I believe we live in the best time in history

transcription: {"text": "Before the year 1850, half the Earth's population died before the age of five. You are living on a planet where half of the Earth's population lives on less than one dollar a day. There's points during the Spanish flu, 60 million people died of that pandemic. Before 1937, there were no broad-spectrum antibiotics, so if you like cut your arm, you might have to have your arm taken off. You want to be grateful? Be grateful you live in this time. That should be enough gratitude for you. But social media makes it hard. Go to the Congo or go to Managua in Peru. Spend some time in those places, and you will absolutely come back with unbelievable levels of gratitude.
